text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
VIDISMedicationSchema 0..*BaseVIDIS MS
This logical model cannot be the target of a reference
identifier 0..*IIIdentifier of the schema
lastUpdated 1..1DTLast time the document was updated
patient 1..1IIIdentifier or reference to the patient
title 1..1STLabel or title of the document
author 0..1IIWho recorded the entry
authoredDate 1..1DTdate/time when entered
type 1..1CDType of schema
medicationLine 0..*classA line of medication
author 0..1IIWho recorded the entry
authoredDate 1..1DTdate/time when entered
uniqueID 1..*IIA unique identifier of the line
version 1..1IIUnique version identifier for the schema
status 1..1CDThe status of the medication treatment entry - active, stopped, entered in error, etc.
lifeCycleStatus 1..1CDThe business state of the treatment - active, stopped, etc.
Binding: Medication line - Treatment status (preferred)
statusReason 0..*CDReason for the medication being in the status
originType 1..1CDWhere the treatment originated - hospital, ambulatory,...
Binding: Medication Line origin type (preferred)
product 1..1classThe medicinal product
productCode 0..1CDThe code of the product, of a specific type (VMP, CNK, CTIX)
medType 1..1CDThe type of medication
Binding: Medication Product Type (preferred)
reason 0..*Reference()Reason for the medication line entry - e.g. diagnosis
treatmentTime 0..1classWhen the treatment is expected to occur
period 0..1classThe date and time the treatment started/stopped
startDate 0..1DTThe date and time the treatment started
endDate 0..1DTThe date and time the treatment stopped
duration 1..1STDuration if exact start/end is not known
dosage 0..1classDosage
quantity 0..1QTDosage quantity
timing 0..1TMDosage quantity
doseRange 0..1TMDosage quantity
dosageChangeReason 0..1QTDosage change reason
dayPeriod 1..1CDThe time of day When the medication is given
Binding: Medication line - time of day (preferred)
route 0..1CDThe route of administration
Binding: Medication line - route of administration (preferred)
instruction 0..*STInstruction for the patient
reaction 0..*classReactions to the medication during this treatment
date 1..1DTThe date of the reaction
type 1..1CDThe reaction code or text
exposure 0..*CDProphylactic, therapeutic, other
note 0..*STOther annotations
access-constraints 0..*CDAdditional indication of privacy needs - for example explicit consent, sensitivity classification, etc.
Binding: Medication Line consent (preferred)

Documentation for this format

element.definition: VIDIS MedicationSchema Data Model
Unique identifier(s) for the schema - can be several, in different unique name spaces

element.short: Last time the document was updated
element.definition: Last time the document was updated

element.short: Identifier or reference to the patient
element.definition: Identifier or reference to the patient. Should be an NISS or BIS number

element.short: Label or title of the document
element.definition: Label or title of the document
Unique identifier of the person who is responsible for the information content. Should be an NISS or BIS number
date/time when entered
Type of schema
A line of medication

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: A unique identifier of the line, including the namespace
